bibl.title: Archaism and Artistic Sources in Roman Egypt. The Coffins of the Soter Family and the Temple of Deir el-Medina. Avec résumés en français et en anglais.
bibl.note: The comparison between the temple of Hathor at Deir el-Medina and 3 coffins belonging to members of the Soter family (c. AD 90-140) suggests that the temple may have been a source for the artists who decorated the coffins. Alternatively, the temple and the coffins may share a third, unidentified source.
bibl.seg: RIGGS Christina, Archaism and Artistic Sources in Roman Egypt. The Coffins of the Soter Family and the Temple of Deir el-Medina. Avec résumés en français et en anglais.

The comparison between the temple of Hathor at Deir el-Medina and 3 coffins belonging to members of the Soter family (c. AD 90-140) suggests that the temple may have been a source for the artists who decorated the coffins. Alternatively, the temple and the coffins may share a third, unidentified source.
